Comments_List:
Strength:
-Really great speakers that discuss chronic disease

I love the seminar series...I look forward to it every week and am happy that we have a new lecturer every week because I've heard other departments do not have it as consistently. The people you find to come in are always very engaging presenters and are passionate about what they do. I'm looking forward to going to the lectures again next year.
really enjoyed the wide array of topics covered during the seminars
Speakers were on the whole fairly boring and represented only a small part of Chronic Disease Epi. Should definitely include a wider range of topics.
a wide range selection of guest speakers.
A good collection of speakers touching diverse subjects.
It's great to let you know various research topics within your area.
There were some great seminars and some that felt a bit unrelated to chronic disease.
Great variety in topics, and very interesting speakers. I also appreciated that some of the speakers stuck around afterwards for a less formal discussion or to network with students
We didn't really learn from the instructor, so I can't say
Nicola did a great job setting everything up! Very organized and good range of topics
a must attend for all first-year CDE students
Yes, I would recommend it cause it gives you a chance to learn the recent research from your area and it can help you find your interests.
I found this time pretty wasteful
Great seminars; would recommend people to drop in if they are not doing anything for lunch.
